intro: Euphrasia alsa, commonly known as the lesser eyebright, is a small, flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in clusters along the ground. Euphrasia alsa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
